intro: Piparea multiflora, commonly known as the common pipewort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are borne on slender, branching stems and are often surrounded by pale green bracts. Piparea multiflora is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic foliage.
